Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED
Name: Shabti of Nectanebo I
Description: This funerary statuette in green faience bears the name of Nectanebo I. The tomb of the first king of the 30th Dynasty is not known and his shabtis are rather rare: one actually only knows six pieces of which one was found at Mitrahineh and two in southern Italy. The example from Brussels, of unknown origin, was part of the Hearst - Hilton Price collection.
